We're closing in on the 10-year anniversary of the September 11 attacks, which means that for almost a decade now the nation's leaders have asked private businesses to look out for potential terrorists.
As we reported yesterday on ALL THINGS CONSIDERED, the Mall of America near Minneapolis has a private counterterrorism unit that does just that.
NPR and the Center for Investigative Reporting examined what types of suspicious people the mall has reported to law enforcement.
NPR's Daniel Zwerdling has our story.
